page.title: 17The Lacon Childe School
page.content: With 571 children, Lacon Childe isn't very large. There are 34 teachers teaching about 20 subjects. Mr. J.D. Carr is headmaster. It is on two sites, the old wing is 250 years old, while the new wing is 30 years old. There is a gymnasium, sports hall and outdoor, heated swimming pool. There are 12 governors, one representative of parents, one of teachers and ten of local and county councils. Chairman is Mrs. M.J. Tomkinson. Year groups are divided into 4, Wrekin, Stretton, Clee and Mortimer. In September, 1985, there will be 72 new entrants, only 3 teaching groups. School uniform is basically white or grey shirts, school tie, maroon sweater, grey skirt for girls and black trousers for boys. There is a P.T.A. which meets monthly and helps organise fetes and other fund raising activities.
